alert.note: Alert for Assumption; Eastern Ascension; Lower Lafourche; Lower Terrebonne; St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Upper Lafourche; Upper Terrebonne; Western Ascension (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 8:04AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of St. John The Baptist, southeastern Ascension, St. James, northwestern St. Charles, Terrebonne, northwestern Lafourche and Assumption Parishes through 845 AM CST... At 804 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near South Vacherie, or 12 miles northeast of Thibodaux, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Houma, Thibodaux, Donaldsonville, Napoleonville, Reserve, Hahnville, Laplace, Gramercy, Lutcher, Lockport, Sorrento, Mathews, Schriever, Montz, Chauvin, Dulac, Garyville, Supreme, Raceland and Chackbay. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 182 and 215. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Assumption; Eastern Ascension; Lower Lafourche; Lower Terrebonne; St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Upper Lafourche; Upper Terrebonne; Western Ascension
